tool_description: Conducts systematic visual examination of artwork condition, documenting visible damage, alterations, and overall preservation state through structured observation protocols.

lighting_conditions.description: Examination lighting setup (natural, LED, halogen, raking light)

examination_areas.description: Specific areas to examine (surface, edges, verso, frame)

damage_types_observed.description: Types of damage visible (cracking, flaking, staining, tears, losses)

overall_condition.description: General condition assessment (excellent, good, fair, poor, critical)

previous_treatments_visible.description: Whether previous conservation treatments are visible

examination_magnification.description: Magnification power used (1x for naked eye, higher for magnified examination)

environmental_factors.description: Environmental conditions affecting examination (temperature, humidity, dust)

surface_irregularities.description: Notable surface texture or structural irregularities observed

color_variations.description: Unusual color changes, fading, or discoloration patterns

error_messages: Invalid artwork_id: Provide a valid artwork identifier from metadata record.
Unsupported lighting conditions: Use one of [natural, LED, halogen, raking light, UV].
Invalid condition rating: Overall condition must be one of [excellent, good, fair, poor, critical].
Invalid magnification: Magnification must be a positive number (1 or greater).
Empty examination areas: Must specify at least one area to examine.
usage: Reference an existing artwork record and systematically examine all specified areas under appropriate lighting. Document all visible conditions objectively.

damage_locations.description: Specific locations where damage was observed

priority_concerns.description: Most urgent condition issues requiring attention

examination_completeness.description: Percentage of standard examination areas covered
